cell

Class Bacteria

  • java.lang.Object
    • cell.Entity
      • cell.Cell
        • cell.Pathogen
          • cell.Bacteria
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Bacteria
extends Pathogen
    This class is used to create the Bacteria pathogen which has the ability to multiply. Features of Version 2.0: This entire class was created. The accessor and mutator methods were created for the bacteria. Time spent on this class: 20 minutes. Features of Version 4.0: This entire class was re-modeled to have new features for the Bacteria pathogen. All the methods were created. The bacteria can send out duplicates of itself to attack and stall antibodies. Time spent on this class: 45 minutes (additive to previous versions).
    Version:
    5.0, June 12, 2014
    Author:
    Salar Hosseini & Sophia Weng

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int ammo
      This integer is used to store the the amount times that the bacteria can send out minion bacteria before the cooldown of this ability.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> projectiles
      This object reference variable to ArrayList (generic type of Projectile) is used to store the different "mini bacteria" that the bacteria can send out to attack the antibodies.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bacteria()
      This is the class constructor which is used to assign values to the instance variables and initialize the variables in the super class (the immunity).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canFire()
      This accessor method is used to check if the bacteria can send out its miny bacteria by checking the amount of times that it can multiply into them (ammo) (if it has more than 0 tries left, true will be returned).
      int getAmmo()
      This accessor method is used to get the amount of times that the user can still send out miny bacteria.
      java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
      This method is used to return the perimeter of the Bacteria.
      java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> getProjectiles()
      This accessor method is used to return (get) the list of projectiles (miny bacteria) that are being sent out.
      void setAmmo(int ammo2)
      This mutator method is used to set the amount of times the ability of the bacteria can be used.

    • Field Detail

      • ammo

        private int ammo
        This integer is used to store the the amount times that the bacteria can send out minion bacteria before the cooldown of this ability.

      • projectiles

        private java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> projectiles
        This object reference variable to ArrayList (generic type of Projectile) is used to store the different "mini bacteria" that the bacteria can send out to attack the antibodies.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bacteria

        public Bacteria()
        This is the class constructor which is used to assign values to the instance variables and initialize the variables in the super class (the immunity).

    • Method Detail

      • getProjectiles

        public java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> getProjectiles()
        This accessor method is used to return (get) the list of projectiles (miny bacteria) that are being sent out.
        Returns:
        ArrayList This is the ArrayList of the Projectile objects which store the attributes of the miny bacteria.

      • canFire

        public boolean canFire()
        This accessor method is used to check if the bacteria can send out its miny bacteria by checking the amount of times that it can multiply into them (ammo) (if it has more than 0 tries left, true will be returned). The if statement is used to check if the bacteria can create any more miny bacteria to send out (if the user can use the ability and they are not in a cooldown). If so, true is returned.
        Returns:
        boolean The boolean returned represents if the user can fire any miny bacterias (true means they can).

      • getAmmo

        public int getAmmo()
        This accessor method is used to get the amount of times that the user can still send out miny bacteria.
        Returns:
        int The integer returned represents the number of times that the user can use the ability of sending out the miny bacteria.

      • setAmmo

        public void setAmmo(int ammo2)
        This mutator method is used to set the amount of times the ability of the bacteria can be used. The if statement is used to check if the user can no longer use the Bacteria's ability. If so, then a cooldown is started for the ability.
        Parameters:
        ammo2 - This integer stores the new amount of times the ability of the bacteria can be used.

      • getBounds

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
        This method is used to return the perimeter of the Bacteria.
        Overrides:
        getBounds in class Entity
        Returns:
        Rectangle The rectangle returned is a representation of an imaginary rectangle around the Bacteria which is used to check for collision.
